Interface Command

All Known Implementing Classes:
AddElementCommand, AddIfMinCommand, AverageParticipantsCommand, CleanHeapCommand, CountByParticipantsCommand, ExecuteScriptCommand, ExitCommand, HelpCommand, ListEverythingCommand, ListInfoCommand, ListMetaData, LoadCommand, ParticipantsByIdCommand, RemoveByBestAlbumCommand, RemoveByIdCommand, RemoveGreaterThanIdCommand, SaveCommand, ShowHistoryCommand, UpdateElementCommand
public interface Command
Interface for all command implementations in the application. Commands represent operations that can be executed on the collection such as adding, removing, updating, or displaying elements.

This interface provides multiple execute method variants to support different command signatures:

  • execute() - Basic execution without arguments
  • executeWithInt(Long) - Execution with an integer parameter
  • executeWithString(String) - Execution with a string parameter
  • executeWithLong(Long) - Execution with a long parameter
  • executeWithId(Long) - Execution with an ID parameter

  • Method Details

    • execute

      void execute()
      Executes the command with no arguments. This is the basic execution method for commands that don't require parameters.

    • executeWithInt

      default void executeWithInt(Long id)
      Executes the command with an integer parameter. Default empty implementation for commands that don't need this variant.
      Parameters:
      id - the integer parameter for the command

    • executeWithString

      default void executeWithString(String s)
      Executes the command with a string parameter. Default empty implementation for commands that don't need this variant.
      Parameters:
      s - the string parameter for the command

    • executeWithLong

      default void executeWithLong(Long id)
      Executes the command with a long parameter. Default empty implementation for commands that don't need this variant.
      Parameters:
      id - the long parameter for the command

    • executeWithId

      default void executeWithId(Long id)
      Executes the command with an ID parameter. Default empty implementation for commands that don't need this variant.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID parameter for the command
